Submodules¶

experiments.experiment module¶

Module that helps with the execution of experiments. Features:

  1. Prepares the ambient for testing

  2. Executes a test training a neural network over a dataset according to a flexible configuration

class experiments.experiment.Experiment(train_dirs: [<class 'str'>], validation_dir: str, summary_interval=100, ckp_interval=200, checkpoint_key: str = None)¶

Bases: abc.ABC

This class helps with the configuration of the pre-established experiments.

checkpoint_loaded¶

It tells whether or not a checkpoint for the training has been loaded, in case that a checkpoint has been required by the User

Returns

it should return True if the checkpoint has been properly loaded into the neural net or if no checkpoint has been requested. It should return false if a checkpoint has been requested but hasn’t been loaded into the net

Return type

bool

data_input¶

Getter for the Data pipeline object

Returns

the data pipeline object of the Experiment

Return type

Data

dataset_name¶

Getter for the name of the dataset associated with the Experiment

Returns

the name of the dataset of the Experiment

Return type

str

execute_experiment()¶

Calls the trainer to perform the experiment with the given configuration. It should raise an exception if the _prepare methods (or prepare_all) hasn’t been executed before this method.

Returns

None

Raises

ExperimentNotPreparedError – if the Experiment hasn’t been prepared before the execution of this method

general_config¶

Getter for the GeneralConfig object

Returns

the GeneralConfig object of the Experiments

Return type

GeneralConfig

neural_net¶

Getter for the Neural network object

Returns

the Neural network object of the Experiment

Return type

Network

optimizer_name¶

Getter for the name of the Optimizer associated with the Experiment

Returns

the name of the optimizer of the Experiment

Return type

str

prepare_all(train_mode: utils.train_modes.TrainMode)¶

It prepares the Experiment object for the test, according to the various parameters given up to this point and also according to the corresponding dataset to which the concrete Experiment is associated. This method calls ALL the _prepare methods defined in the base class.

Parameters

train_mode – Indicates the training mode that is going to be used

Returns

None

trainer¶

Getter for the Trainer object

Returns

the Trainer object of the Experiment

Return type

Trainer

experiments.experiments module¶

IoC container for the Experiment objects

class experiments.experiments.Experiments¶

Bases: object

IoC container for the basic experiments included in the framework, which corresponds to datasets:

  • Caltech-101

  • CIFAR-10

  • CIFAR-100

  • MNIST

  • Tiny Imagenet

  • Caltech 256

  • Fashion MNIST

classmethod get_experiment(str_trainer: str, str_dataset: str)¶

Gets an Experiment object factory

Parameters

  • str_trainer – a string representing the trainer/optimizer

  • str_dataset – a string representing the dataset

Returns

a Factory provider for the desired trainer and dataset

Return type

Factory

testers = {'TR_BASE': {'CALTECH-101': <class 'experiments.caltech101.caltech_exp_rms.CaltechExperimentRMSProp'>, 'CALTECH-256': <class 'experiments.caltech256.caltech_256_exp_rms.Caltech256ExperimentRMSProp'>, 'CIFAR-10': <class 'experiments.cifar10.cifar_exp_rms.CifarExperimentRMSProp'>, 'CIFAR-100': <class 'experiments.cifar100.cifar100_exp_rms.Cifar100ExperimentRMSProp'>, 'FASHION-MNIST': <class 'experiments.fashion_mnist.fashion_mnist_exp_rms.FashionMnistExperimentRMSProp'>, 'MNIST': <class 'experiments.mnist.mnist_exp_rms.MnistExperimentRMSProp'>, 'TINY IMAGENET': <class 'experiments.imagenet.imagenet_exp_rms.ImagenetExperimentRMSProp'>}, 'TR_REP': {'CALTECH-101': <class 'experiments.caltech101.caltech_exp_rep.CaltechExperimentRep'>, 'CIFAR-10': <class 'experiments.cifar10.cifar_exp_rep.CifarExperimentRep'>, 'FASHION-MNIST': <class 'experiments.fashion_mnist.fashion_mnist_exp_rep.FashionMnistExperimentRep'>, 'MNIST': <class 'experiments.mnist.mnist_exp_rep.MnistExperimentRep'>, 'TINY IMAGENET': <class 'experiments.imagenet.imagenet_exp_rep.ImagenetExperimentRep'>}}¶

experiments.tester module¶

Module for performing testing/validation of a model

class experiments.tester.Tester(model: libs.caffe_tensorflow.network.Network, pipeline: etl.data.data.Data, tensor_x: tensorflow.python.framework.ops.Tensor, tensor_y: tensorflow.python.framework.ops.Tensor)¶

Bases: object

Class for performing and saving tests of a model, with various metrics (e.g. accuracy)

static create_writer(summaries_path: str, identifier: int)¶

Creates a tf.summary.FileWriter, that saves results to summaries_path/increment_{id}

Parameters

  • summaries_path – the path of the directory where the results of the tests are going to be saved

  • identifier – an ID for identifying the writer. This is used for the name of the file where the results are going to be saved

Returns

a tf.summary.FileWriter object

perform_validation(sess, iteration: int, writer: tensorflow.python.summary.writer.writer.FileWriter)¶

Performs validation over the test data and register the results in the form of summaries that can be interpreted by Tensorboard. The prepare method must have been called at least once before using this method, otherwise, an Exception may occur.

Parameters

  • sess – the current session

  • iteration – the current iteration number over the training data

  • writer – a FileWriter properly configured

Returns

None

prepare()¶

It does the preparation for the training. This preparations include: -Creates operators needed for summaries for TensorBoard

Returns

None

static save_loss(sess, loss, iteration: int, writer: tensorflow.python.summary.writer.writer.FileWriter)¶

Saves the loss value into the summary file for TensorBoard

Parameters

  • sess – the current session

  • loss – the loss value for the current iteration

  • iteration – the current iteration number over the training data

  • writer – a FileWriter properly configured

Returns

None
